long description: Voicing contrast in both plosives and fricatives

description: None missing in /p t k b d g/

Initial: stress is on the first syllable
Second: stress is on the second syllable
Third: stress is on the third syllable
Antepenultimate: stress is on the antepenultimate (third from the right) syllable
Penultimate: stress is on the penultimate (second from the right) syllable
Ultimate: stress is on the ultimate (last) syllable
Left-edge: Stress is on the first or second syllable

description: Left-oriented: One of the first three
long description: Left-oriented: The third syllable is involved
Right-edge: Stress on ultimate or penultimate syllable

description: Right-oriented: One of the last three

long description: Unbounded: Stress can be anywhere in the word
No weight, or weight factor unknown

Coda consonant: closed syllables are heavy for stress
Long vowel + Coda: long vowels or closed syllables
Prominence: other factors are heavy for stress
Combined: two of the above factors determine weight
Trochaic: left-hand syllable in the foot is strong

Dual: system has both trochaic and iambic feet
Approximately equal amounts of suffixing and prefixing

Zero: Ordinal numerals do not exist

Second: 'First' and a small set of consecutive higher ordinal numerals are suppletive
